page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: A rural area 3 Km SW of Bath and 8 Km SE of Bristol forming part of Wansdyke District in the county of Avon. It consists of Tunley ,Dunkerton and part of Englishcombe Civil Parishes. Hilly wholly agricultural area drained by the Cam and Conygre brooks and many natural springs. The main roads are the A367 from Bath to Radstock and B3115 to Timsbury. The Fosseway (Roman road) passes through near Dunkerton. Lightly populated with the majority of the workforce employed in Bath and nearby towns. There is no local industry; coal mining, once extensive, ceased over twenty years ago. There are no local hospitals, doctors or dentists, Bath and Radstock providing all health amenities. A mobile library visits fortnightly. All children go to school outside the area. Police patrol by car from Bath.
